value.title: PowerBI.Tips - Tutorial - Introduction to DAX Studio - By Darren Gosbell
value.excerpt: DAX Studio is the tool for data model tuning.  Darren Gosbell the creator of DAX Studio will be giving a live demo of his tool.    In this webinar we will be reviewing the following topics:  - What is DAX Studio?  - Why should I use DAX Studio?  - Getting started and connecting DAX Studio to various

value.title: PowerBI.Tips - Tutorial - Model Performance Tuning in DAX Studio - By Marco Russo
value.excerpt: DAX Studio is the tool for data model tuning.  Marco Russo contributor to DAX Studio will be giving us a deep dive and demo around using DAX Studio for Model Performance Tuning.   You will not want to miss this event as Marco is a wealth of knowledge for all things Data Modeling!  Watch the Full Tutorial

value.title: PowerBI.tips - Tutorial - Monkey Tool Introduction - Part 1
value.excerpt: Ken Puls an amazing MVP from Excel Guru has produced an impressive tool, Monkey Tools.  This tool is an Excel Add-in that aids business users to work quickly building Data Models.  Come join us to learn about how this tool can help you in your daily work flow.  Follow Ken  Blog: https://xlguru.ca/blog

value.title: Age Banding in Power BI using Power Query   Merge Queries Based on Between
value.excerpt: Age banding is a common scenario in analytics, and I have explained how it is possible in many different ways. value.title: Age Banding in Power BI Using TREATAS DAX Function   Relationship Based on Between

The age group banding can be created in Power Query at the data transformation stage. It can be created using the Grouping and Binning

value.title: Aggregated Table in Power BI   Using GroupBy Function in DAX
value.excerpt: There are many different ways you can create aggregations in Power BI, You can do it in the source (using the database t-SQL language), or using Group By operation in Power Query. You can also do it in DAX using some functions. One of the functions that can be used for grouping and aggregation is Group

value.title: Aggregated Table in Power BI with Extra Options   Summarize Function in DAX
value.excerpt: In the previous video, I explained how you can use GROUPBY function in DAX to create an aggregated table. value.title: Aggregation and composite model: Microsoft Power BI fast and furious - THR3016
value.excerpt: The composite model enables you to have huge tables as a DirectQuery source, and some other smaller tables as in import mode. value.title: Aggregation to speed up the performance of a Power BI report even if all IMPORTED
value.excerpt: One of the questions I normally get after presenting about aggregations in Power BI is that, does the aggregation works only for Composite mode and in scenarios to speed up the DirectQuery? or does it work in import mode as well? value.title: Be Careful When Merging on Text Fields in Power BI Using Power Query
value.excerpt: Merging two tables in Power Query is one of the most useful transformations to combine data from different datasets, and also create a flatten data structure. However, if you use a text field for merge, then you might see some unexpected results. Here in this video, I share some important considerations

value.title: Best Practice for Power BI Workspace Roles Setup
value.excerpt: Power BI workspaces are not like old days, that we had Edit access and View access anymore.
